Ecclesiasticus *__44.1: Let us now praise men of renown, and our fathers in their generation.
Ecclesiasticus *__44.2: The Lord hath wrought great glory through his magnificence from the beginning.
Ecclesiasticus *__44.3: Such as have borne rule in their dominions, men of great power, and endued with their wisdom, shewing forth in the prophets the dignity of prophets,
Ecclesiasticus *__44.4: And ruling over the present people, and by the strength of wisdom instructing the people in most holy words.
Ecclesiasticus *__44.5: Such as by their skill sought out musical tunes, and published canticles of the scriptures.
Ecclesiasticus *__44.6: Rich men in virtue, studying beautifulness: living at peace in their houses.
Ecclesiasticus *__44.7: All these have gained glory in their generations, and were praised in their days.
Ecclesiasticus *__44.8: They that were born of them have left a name behind them, that their praises might be related:
Ecclesiasticus *__44.9: And there are some, of whom there is no memorial: who are perished, as if they had never been: and are become as if they had never been born, and their children with them.
Ecclesiasticus *__44.10: But these were men of mercy, whose godly deeds have not failed:
Ecclesiasticus *__44.11: Good things continue with their seed,
Ecclesiasticus *__44.12: Their posterity are a holy inheritance, and their seed hath stood in the covenants.
Ecclesiasticus *__44.13: And their children for their sakes remain for ever: their seed and their glory shall not be forsaken.
Ecclesiasticus *__44.14: Their bodies are buried in peace, and their name liveth unto generation and generation.
Ecclesiasticus *__44.15: Let the people shew forth their wisdom, and the church declare their praise.
Ecclesiasticus *__44.16: Henoch pleased God, and was translated into paradise, that he may give repentance to the nations.
Ecclesiasticus *__44.17: Noe was found perfect, just, and in the time of wrath he was made a reconciliation.
Ecclesiasticus *__44.18: Therefore was there a remnant left to the earth, when the flood came.
Ecclesiasticus *__44.19: The covenants of the world were made with him, that all flesh should no more be destroyed with the flood.
Ecclesiasticus *__44.20: Abraham was the great father of a multitude of nations, and there was not found the like to him in glory, who kept the law of the most High, and was in covenant with him.
Ecclesiasticus *__44.21: In his flesh he established the covenant, and in temptation he was found faithful.
Ecclesiasticus *__44.22: Therefore by an oath he gave him glory in his posterity, that he should increase as the dust of the earth,
Ecclesiasticus *__44.23: And that he would exalt his seed as the stars, and they should inherit from sea to sea, and from the river to the ends of the earth.
Ecclesiasticus *__44.24: And he did in like manner with Isaac for the sake of Abraham his father.
Ecclesiasticus *__44.25: The Lord gave him the blessing of all nations, and confirmed his covenant upon the head of Jacob.
Ecclesiasticus *__44.26: He acknowledged him in his blessings, and gave him an inheritance, and divided him his portion in twelve tribes.
Ecclesiasticus *__44.27: And he preserved for him men of mercy, that found grace in the eyes of all flesh.
